ipd.creole.casetagger
Class CLaCUtils

java.lang.Object
  ipd.creole.casetagger.CLaCUtils
All Implemented Interfaces:
gate.creole.ANNIEConstants, gate.GateConstants
public class CLaCUtils
extends Object
implements gate.GateConstants, gate.creole.ANNIEConstants

A class contains miscellaneous funtional methods that might ease the work in Gate Component Developing.

Method Detail

getDocAnnotated

public static String getDocAnnotated(gate.Document doc,
                                     gate.Annotation anno)
                              throws gate.util.InvalidOffsetException
Get the content of the document that has been marked up by the given gate.Annotation.

Parameters:
doc - The gate.Document object representing the current document.
anno - The desired gate.Annotation representing the markup.
Returns:
The java.lang.String object representing the annotated content.
Throws:
gate.util.InvalidOffsetException - When the given annotation is invalid.

sortAnnotations

public static List sortAnnotations(gate.AnnotationSet annoSet)
Sort the given AnnotationSet that contains annotations according the order defined by gate.util.OffsetComparator

Parameters:
annoSet - The AnnotationSet object that to be sorted.
Returns:
One java.util.List object that contains that sorted annotation(s).

sortAnnotations

public static List sortAnnotations(gate.AnnotationSet annoSet,
                                   Comparator comparator)
Sort the given AnnotationSet that contains some annotations with the provided comparator.

Parameters:
annoSet - The AnnotationSet object that to be sorted.
comparator - The specified comparator representing certain defined orders.
Returns:
One List that contains annotations sorted according to the order defined by the comparator.

sortAnnotations

public static void sortAnnotations(List annoList)
Sort the given AnnotationSet that contains some annotations of the same type, using the gate.util.OffsetComparator

Parameters:
annoList - The AnnotationSet object that to be sorted.

getAnnotationCovering

public static List getAnnotationCovering(gate.AnnotationSet set,
                                         Long startOffset,
                                         Long endOffset,
                                         boolean strict)
Get annotations in the annotation set that have span larger than the specified span. The difference between this method and Gate.AnnotationSet.get() method is the latter will also retrieve annotations whose span are contained by the specified span.

Parameters:
set - The AnnotationSet object that to be searched.
startOffset - The start offset of the span.
endOffset - The end offset of the span.
strict - If the returned annotation must be strictly larger than the specified span or could be partially contained by the span
Returns:
One java.util.List object that contains that sorted annotation(s).

getTokenContentInAnnotation

public static String getTokenContentInAnnotation(gate.Document doc,
                                                 gate.Annotation anno)
                                          throws Exception
Get the concatencated String from the included token annotations. Because We might do some post processings with the tokens, such as the number combination, sometimes the concatenated string of those tokens might be different with the orginal content that is directly extracted from the document body.

Parameters:
doc - The gate.Document instance that comes with the DEFAULT annotation set
anno - The gate.Annotation instance
Returns:
The String of the concatenated tokens within the annoation span
Throws:
Exception - When there is no token within the given annotation span or something else.

getTokenContentInAnnotation

public static String getTokenContentInAnnotation(gate.AnnotationSet inputAS,
                                                 gate.Annotation anno)
                                          throws Exception
Get the concatencated String from the token annotations covered by the specified annotation. Because We might do some post processings with the tokens, such as the number combination, sometimes the concatenated string of those tokens might be different with the orginal content that is directly extracted from the document body.

Parameters:
inputAS - The given input AnnotationSet
anno - The gate.Annotation instance
Returns:
The String of the concatenated tokens within the annoation span
Throws:
Exception - When there is no token within the given annotation span or something else.

getTokenContentInSpan

public static String getTokenContentInSpan(gate.AnnotationSet inputAS,
                                           Long spanStartOffset,
                                           Long spanEndOffset)
                                    throws Exception
Get the concatencated String from the tokens covered by the specified span. Because We might do some post processings with the tokens, such as the number combination, sometimes the concatenated string of those tokens might be different with the orginal content that is directly extracted from the document body.

Parameters:
inputAS - The given input AnnotationSet
spanStartOffset - The starting offset of the span
spanEndOffset - The endding offset of the span
Returns:
The String of the concatenated tokens within the annoation span
Throws:
Exception - When there is no token within the given annotation span or something else.

getAnnotationContainingId

public gate.Annotation getAnnotationContainingId(gate.Document document,
                                                 Integer id,
                                                 String type)
Retrieve specific annotation containing another annotation with a specified ID. This method is added to tackle the weird problem caused by Gate's Nominal/Pronominal correferencer.

Parameters:
document - the document containing the specified annotation
id - the ID of the annotation
type - the type of the annotation to be retrieved
Returns:
the annotation of type containing the specified annotation

                                                         Integer id)
Retrieve sentence containing a specified ID This method is added to tackle the weird problem caused by Gate's Nominal/Pronominal correferencer.

Parameters:
document - the document containing the specified annotation
id - the ID of the annotation
Returns:
the sentence annotation containing the specified annotation

public static Integer getDocumentId(gate.Document document,
                                    gate.Annotation anno)
Return the number (id) of the single document within a collection the provided annotation is part of

Parameters:
document - the multi-document collection (created with combine-multi-docs.pl)
anno - the annotation to be checked
Returns:
the ID of the single document containing anno, null if not found

Returns:
the number of single documents in this collection

getSingleDocAnnotationSet

public static gate.AnnotationSet getSingleDocAnnotationSet(gate.Document doc,
                                                           int docNo)
Get the default annotation set for a certain single document. REMEMBER:!!! The No/Index for the first single doc is 0!!

Parameters:
doc - The gate.Document instance referring to the current "big" combined document
docNo - The number of the desired document. NOTICE that the no. for the first document is 0

getSingleDocNamedAnnotationSet

public static gate.AnnotationSet getSingleDocNamedAnnotationSet(gate.Document doc,
                                                                int docNo,
                                                                String annoSetName)
Get the annotation set for a certain single document from the specified annotation set. This method is used for one single doc within a multidoc. It is to get the annotations that are located within an annotation set other than the default annotation set, such as the original markup annotation set

Parameters:
doc - The gate.Document instance referring to the current "big" combined document
docNo - The number of the desired document. NOTICE that the no. for the first document is 0
annoSetName - The name of the annotation set
Returns:
The annotation set that has the particular name, or null if it does not exist. NOTICE: the difference

isMultiDoc

public static boolean isMultiDoc(gate.Document document)
Check whether or not the given gate.Document object is an XML in CLaC customized multi-doc format.

Parameters:
document - The Gate.Document object to be checked

mapURL2LocalPath

public static String mapURL2LocalPath(URL u)
Get the mapping between customized URL protocol and the actual local path. 
   clac :          by default it should actually point to $HOME/clac
   clacclasses :   by default it should actually point to $HOME/clac/Gate
   clacresources : by default it should actually point to $HOME/clac/Resources
   clactools :     by default it should actually point to $HOME/tools
   userhome:       by default it should point to $HOME

Parameters:
u - The encountered protocol
Returns:
String of the real local path the protocol points to

mapURL2LocalDir

public static String mapURL2LocalDir(URL u)
This method is obsolete and is kept here for compability only, please refer to or use mapURL2LocalPath instead.

Parameters:
u - The encountered protocol
Returns:
String of the real local path the protocol points to.

init

public static void init()
                 throws Exception
perform the customized initialization tasks. 
 1. Check the location of the local repository directory and the external tools directory, 
    The checking is based on the startup environment variables ( not the system default ones that
    are set in the .bash_profile, because the Java code can't access them ).
 2. Register the customized URL protocol handlers, such as "clac:" "clacresources:"

Throws:
Exception

getCLaCResource

public static Object getCLaCResource(String nameResource)
A tentative method to get resource that is shared among different processing resource.

public static void putCLaCResource(String nameResource,
                                   Object newResource)
A tentative method to add resource that is shared among different processing resource.

getEnvVar

public static String getEnvVar(String varName)
Access the environment variable

Parameters:
varName - name of the environment variable
Returns:
String value of the environment variable or null if it is unaccessible in the current shell or the system call fails.
